name: The New Europeans AISBL
membership:
European Civic Forum
European Association for the Defence of Human Right (AEDH)
goal:
New Europeans is a civil rights organisation which aims to promote European citizenship and a Europe of the Citizens.

We were set up in 2013 in London to give EU27 citizens in the UK and Britons in the EU a voice.

We continue to campaign for the rights of transnationals EU citizens including the right to freedom of movement. We also campaign for the rights of third country nationals including migrants and refugees.

New Europeans is a membership organisation with members and branches in EU member states and outside the EU.

We campaign for a new form of European citizenship based on permanent residency of an EU member state.

In addition to our campaigns we run grant-funded programmes through New Europeans Association Ltd which is based in the UK.

Our programmes are aimed at empowering EU citizens through informing them about their rights and by training volunteers and community activists.

We have a Citizenship Unit based in Brussels which commissions expert reports and analyses of issues related to European citizenship.
interests: Borders and Security, Climate Action, Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Regional Policy, Youth
euInitiatives:
Article 50 negotiations on the UK's withdrawal from the European Union

The Future of Europe
